page.title: 04DRAINAGE-RIVER OUSE (i)
page.content: Our four by three kilometre area is covered by the Middle Fen Drainage Board.It has six main drainage channels.The water from these has to be pumped up into the River Lark.This is because the peat soil shrinks as it dries out and so the River is embanked above the surrounding farmland to prevent flooding.From the River Lark the water flows into the River Ouse and reaches the sea at Kings Lynn.In 1829 the banks of the River Ouse were straightened for six miles from Ely to Littleport and this part is called Sandys Cut.Most water is pumped from the farmland in winter.The main pumping station is at Prickwillow and has two diesel and two electric pumps. The electric pumps run at night because the electricity is cheaper.
